instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after liquid damage.
Question mark folder.
SSD tested on other MBA and works fine.
Tested with SSD from another MBA and still same issue.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> 3.34V
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.34V
<SIGNAL>SATA_PCIE_SEL</SIGNAL> 3.28V
<CHIP>U4510</CHIP> pin 1 3.34V
<RESISTOR>R4520</RESISTOR> 3.34V

P1 / P2
<CAPACITOR>C4510</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.299
<CAPACITOR>C4511</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.299
<CAPACITOR>C4512</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.323
<CAPACITOR>C4513</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.323
<CAPACITOR>C4514</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.295
<CAPACITOR>C4515</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.295
<CAPACITOR>C4516</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.295
<CAPACITOR>C4517</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.295
<CAPACITOR>C4518</CAPACITOR> 0.763 0.295


Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message: Where was the liquid damage? You test all sort of stuff on <CHIP>U4520</CHIP> but why not check on the connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message:
Some other shop tried ti fix liquid damage - cant see any signs of liquid on the board.

Checked connector and looks OK, all voltages looks good as well on connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message: There is more than just voltages to the connector. Diode mode on data pins, also capacitors from connector to <CHIP>U4520</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD
threads.message: I meant <CHIP>U4510</CHIP> of course. <CAPACITOR>C4520</CAPACITOR>/21 present and traces good? Did a PRAM reset?
